facility_type.description: The primary classification of the healthcare facility. Different facility types face different regulatory requirements, serve different patient populations, and have vastly different HIM department resources — all of which directly affect ROI form design and accessibility.

system_affiliation.description: Whether the organization operates independently or as part of a larger health system, and the scale of that system. System affiliation affects IT investment, standardization of patient-facing processes, and whether ROI forms are centrally designed or locally managed.

ownership.description: The governance and financial model of the organization. Ownership type influences resource allocation toward patient experience, compliance culture, and whether ROI processes prioritize operational efficiency over patient accessibility.

census_region.description: The U.S. Census Bureau region where the organization is located. State-level health information privacy laws vary significantly by region, and regional healthcare market dynamics affect organizational resources and patient expectations.

unrealistic_combinations: FQHC with for-profit ownership — federal statute requires FQHCs to be nonprofit or public entities
FQHC affiliated with a major or regional hospital system — FQHCs are independently governed community organizations by federal requirement
Critical access hospital with for-profit ownership — CAH economics and rural safety-net mission make investor-owned operation essentially nonviable (fewer than 1% nationally)
Physician practice with government ownership — government-operated physician practices are limited to VA/military systems excluded from this study
Teaching hospital that is both for-profit and independently operated — major teaching programs require system-level infrastructure and academic affiliation
